paragraphs.name: bcc2
paragraphs.text: What does this mean for your son? As the mother of two white boys myself, this is something I think about as well. Your son, like my boys, has the right to his experiences and his feelings about those experiences — just like everyone else has the right to theirs. And I’m sure it’s annoying for him to experience people making negative assumptions about him because he is a white male. But it’s also time for him to grow up. For example, black women put up with people’s negative assumptions about them on a regular basis.

paragraphs.text: Explain to your son that anyone can be discriminated against by someone of another race, but racism is something different altogether. The “ism” implies a practice, system or philosophy that unfairly bestows favor or privilege upon a specific race, while suppressing others.

paragraphs.name: 81aa
paragraphs.text: Thank you Roseland. However you obtained your wisdom and objectivity is exactly the principles and actions that only white America can take to eradicate racism in America. The NAACP long argued that racism is just as harmful to whites as it is to minorities. If we are to live up to the principles & values the flawed writers of the US Constitution…

Thank you for writing this. It reminds me of Azar Nafisi’s phrase “facile indignation,” which describes this very phenomenon where people with privilege object to the slightest form of dehumanization that members of dominated groups have dealt with at much higher degrees for centuries…without objection from those same individuals who would ostensibly be so concerned about fairness and humanizing people.

463af2b3d45c.title: I have two white boys as well and one thing I never did is ruin them with my own assumptions about…

paragraphs.text: I have two white boys as well and one thing I never did is ruin them with my own assumptions about people in general. I didn’t worry them to death about being white nor concerning themselves with the imagine “plight” of others. I spent my time helping them grow up to be fine young men who are able to work and provide for themselves and their families. Its a thing normal people do for their children.
